intro: Tribulus alatus var. monodii, commonly known as the hairy spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds with a hard, smooth coat. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along coastal areas. Due to its hardy nature, it is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
